meanings.definition: ミリ規定、ミリ当量濃度
meanings.english_definition: A unit of concentration equal to 1/1000 of a normality (N) solution.

examples.sentence: The solution has a millinormality of 0.01.
examples.translation: その溶液のミリ規定度は0.01である。

usage_notes.explanation: Millinormality (mN) is a unit used in chemistry to express the concentration of a solution. It is defined as one-thousandth of a normality (N) solution. Normality, in turn, is a measure of the number of gram equivalent weights of a solute per liter of solution. Millinormality is often used when dealing with very dilute solutions.
